Kawasan Industri Milik Tommy Soeharto di Karawang Menunggak Pajak Miliar Rupiah
05 Nov 2019, 08:23 by Dodo Rihanto
KARAWANG, (PR).- Kawasan Industri Mandala Putra, salah satu  perusahaan milik Tommy Soeharto di Cikampek, terindikasi menunggak Pajak Bumi dan Bangunan senilai miliaran rupiah ke Pemerintah Kabupaten Karawang.
Oleh Tommy Soeharto, kawasan industri itu sebelumnya dipersiapkan untuk memproduksi mobil Timor Putra Nasional.
Hal itu diungkapkan Pelaksana tugas Kepala Badan Pendapatan Daerah Karawang Ahmad Mustopa, didampingi Kepala Bidang PBB dan BPHTB Endang Cahedra, Selasa 5 November 2019.
"Saat ini kami sedang berupaya memburu sejumlah perusahaan besar yang menunggak pajak. Jika terus menunggak, jumlah tunggakan pajak akan terus bertambah," kata Ahmad Mustopa.
Kawasan industri Mandala Putra milik Tommy Soeharto sebelumnya dikenal dengan sebutan Mandala Pratama Permai. Luasnya mencapai 700 hektare. Pada masa Orde Baru, kawasan itu mendapat dispensasi pajak dari pemerintah.
Setelah Orde Baru tumbang dan pengelolaan PBB diserahkan ke pemerintah daerah, perusahaan harus membayar PBB. Namun, perusahaan tak pernah memenuhi kewajibannya.
Mencapai Rp 525 miliar
Selain perusahaan milik Tommy Soeharto, banyak pula perusahaan lain yang menunggak PBB kepada Pemkab Karawang. Jika diakumulasikan, total piutang pajak tersebut mencapai Rp 525 miliar.
"Penunggak pajak itu kebanyakan pabrik-pabrik yang telah mati di zona industri wilayah Klari, Cikampek, hingga perbatasan Purwakarta.
"Kalau kami ke lokasi pabrik itu, yang ada hanya satpam," ujar Endang Cahendra.
Menurut dia, pabrik-pabrik itu bangkrut karena berbagai alasan. Salah satunya karena lahirnya aturan mengenai relokasi pabrik ke kawasan industri.
Undang-Undang Nomor 2 tahun 2014 tentang Perindustrian mewajibkan seluruh pabrik masuk ke kawasan industri. Kewajiban relokasi bertujuan memudahkan pemerintah memantau dan meminimalkan dampak pencemaran lingkungan.
"Pabrik-pabrik di zona industri, satu-persatu mulai ditertibkan. Jadi, lahannya ada tapi sudah tidak beroperasi. Kendati pabriknya sudah mati, PBB tetap harus dibayar," kata Endang.
Kepada pemilik pabrik-pabrik itu, Endang sudah ratusan kali melayangkan surat teguran. Namun, tak digubris. Pada 2018, Bapenda Karawang melayangkan 146 surat teguran. Pada 2019, jumlah surat teguran naik drastis hingga 254. "Kami tak akan berhenti berupaya," ujarnya.
Karena surat teguran dinilai tak efektif, Bapenda mulai merayu perusahaan dengan berbagai program termasuk pengampunan pajak atau menghapus denda pajak.
"Setidaknya, yang bersangkutan membayar pokoknya. Setidaknya, ada pemasukan ke Pemda," tuturnya.
Endang mengimbau perusahaan-perusahaan tersebut memanfaatkan kebijakan penghapusan denda tersebut. "Sebab, penghabusan denda berlaku sampai akhir November tahun ini," kata Endang.***

Tommy Soeharto's Industrial Estate in Karawang is in arrears of a Billion Rupiah Tax
05 Nov 2019, 08:23 by Dodo Rihanto
KARAWANG, (PR) .- Mandala Putra Industrial Estate, one of the companies owned by Tommy Soeharto in Cikampek, is indicated to be in arrears of land and building tax worth billions of rupiahs to the Karawang regency government.
By Tommy Soeharto, the industrial area was previously prepared to produce Timor Putra Nasional cars.
This was revealed by the Acting Head of Karawang Regional Revenue Agency Ahmad Mustopa, accompanied by the Head of the UN and BPHTB Endang Cahedra, Tuesday, November 5, 2019.
"At the moment we are trying to hunt down a number of large companies that are in arrears on tax. If it continues to arrears, the amount of tax arrears will continue to grow," Ahmad Mustopa said.
Tommy Soeharto's Mandala Putra industrial estate was formerly known as the Mandala Pratama Permai. The extent of reaching 700 hectares. During the New Order era, the region received a tax dispensation from the government.
After the New Order collapsed and the management of the United Nations was handed over to the local government, the company had to pay the United Nations. However, the company has never fulfilled its obligations.
Reached IDR 525 billion
In addition to the company owned by Tommy Soeharto, many other companies are in arrears to the Karawang regency. If accumulated, the total tax receivables reach Rp. 525 billion.
"The tax arrears are mostly dead factories in the industrial zone of the Klari region, Cikampek, to the Purwakarta border.
"If we go to the factory site, there will only be security guards," said Endang Cahendra.
According to him, the factories went bankrupt for various reasons. One of them is due to the birth of regulations regarding the relocation of factories to industrial areas.
Law Number 2 of 2014 concerning Industry requires all factories to enter the industrial estate. The relocation obligation aims to facilitate the government to monitor and minimize the impact of environmental pollution.
"Factories in the industrial zone, one by one began to be put in order. So, the land is there but it is not operating. Even though the factory is dead, the UN still has to be paid for," Endang said.
To the owners of these factories, Endang had sent a letter of reprimand hundreds of times. However, ignored. In 2018, Bapenda Karawang sent 146 letters of reprimand. In 2019, the number of warning letters rose dramatically to 254. "We will not stop trying," he said.
Because the reprimand letter was deemed ineffective, Bapenda began to seduce companies with various programs including tax amnesty or removing tax penalties.
"At least, the person concerned pays the principal. At least, there is income to the Regional Government," he said.
Endang appealed to the companies to take advantage of the policy of eliminating these fines. "Because, the fine is valid until the end of November this year," said Endang. ***
